archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Ghost Chilli Beef Tacos with Lime Slaw and Charred Jalapeño Salsa
description: Fiery ground beef folded into crisp taco shells, cooled slightly with lime-dressed cabbage and a smoky, charred jalapeño-tomato salsa. Built fast for heat lovers.
prep_steps: Halve 2 limes and set aside for juice.
Finely chop 1 onion (divide: 2/3 for beef, 1/3 for salsa).
Slice 3 jalapenos lengthwise; leave seeds for extra heat.
Finely chop a small piece of ghost chilli (about 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon minced; wash hands after).
Preheat OutdoorGrill to high (or a grill pan) for charring jalapeños and warming taco shells.
Set a large stovetop skillet over medium-high heat.
cook_steps: Char the jalapenos on the OutdoorGrill until blistered on all sides, 3–5 minutes; cool slightly, then chop.
Make salsa: In a bowl, combine chopped jalapenos, diced tomatoes, 1/3 of the chopped onion, half the coriander, juice of 1/2 lime, and a pinch of salt; set aside.
Make lime slaw: In a large bowl, toss shredded cabbage with juice of 1–1.5 limes, 1 tablespoon vinegar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt; set aside to soften.
Cook beef: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to the hot skillet. Add remaining onion and cook 2 minutes. Add minced garlic and minced ghost chilli; stir 30 seconds.
Add 500 g ground beef; cook, breaking up, until browned, 5–6 minutes. Drain excess fat if needed.

Season beef: Stir in 2 teaspoons chilli powder, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 2 tablespoons tomato paste, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Add 2–3 tablespoons water and simmer 1–2 minutes until saucy. For extra heat, stir in 1 tablespoon habanero sauce.
Warm taco shells on the OutdoorGrill 30–60 seconds until fragrant and crisp.
Assemble: Fill taco shells with spicy beef. Top with lime slaw and spoonfuls of charred jalapeño salsa. Finish with remaining coriander.
